column4: I need to adjust my monitor position without using the monitor inbuilt keys ....any idea guys ?
what is the display card you are using? I mean nvidia..
nvidia has a software for it I know. But I am using intel inbuilt graphics card for 845GLLY
my resolutions and refresh rates are all same and ok for both the OS
Okay.
But what is the actual problem you are facing?
I generated the modeline and used it pretty well

When I boot from linux to XP or vice versa, my display is slided and I have to use the monitor OSD buttons to place it correctly on position. But when I place it correctly for one OS I lose the position in the other OS :(
you have to save the screen settings after you made changes  xorg
still I am looking to solve your problem.
Try this command and get back to me. sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
but I think It will just replace my custom modeline in file xorg.conf with the default one thats flickering
save your screen settings to xorg.conf that's it.
send me screen shot I will solve your problem completely
Everything you can do with ubuntu.
the screen shot will capture just the screen that is displayed. It will not capture the black shifted part. It will look absolutely normal and I have tried that already
thanks for those searches. I think I will now do some hit and trial with the vsync and hsync in the xorg.conf modeline and check will they move the postion. :) !
you might not have such problems is you use CRT
sry *LCD
http://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?qid=20091023053323AA1EdJD you can see my problem in more detail here
before I have the same problem.
